intro: Verbascum schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
